title: Postcards from the Edge (1990) Streep+MacLaine DVDrip
description:
<a href="http://imdb.com/title/tt0100395/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">http://imdb.com/title/tt0100395/</a>

English subs in separate idx/sub files.

Shirley MacLaine and Meryl Streep in the same film! One may wonder who has the worst problems -- the neurotic, famous actress-mother, or her upcoming actress-daughter in rehab. Meryl showed already in this film that she really can sing on her own.

Based on first novel by Carrie Fisher, depicting the life with her actress mother, Debbie Reynolds.

'One of the best American screenplays of the last 50 years' - User comment on Imdb.

One of my favourites, could never find a torrent for it, so I picked up the DVD during a recent visit to the U.S.


Widescreen, good stereo
DVDrip. XviD Two-pass 704x384 AC3
Source: NTSC IVTC
Burn tested, runs well in my DivX player.
